intro: Lastrea oreopteris, commonly known as the rock fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a small, epiphytic fern that typically grows on rocks or tree trunks in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive, creeping rhizome with small, lance-shaped fronds. Its spores are produced in clusters on the underside of the fronds, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique growth habit and habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
